Title: Comparison of Saffron and Photobiomodulation on light damaged rat retina
Notes: Direct PBM intervention on retina with transcriptomics, ideal PBM mechanism dataset

Title: Transcriptome of pineal gland Crx knockout
Notes: Pineal tissue, no relevance to project

Title: Minocycline rescues retinal degeneration under light damage
Notes: Light damage model but focus on drug, can provide background on light-stress pathways

Title: Stem cell retinal organoid differentiation with retinal
Notes: Organoid development study, not disease or light intervention

Title: Circadian transcriptome of mouse RPE
Notes: Circadian biology study, not PBM or myopia

Title: Photoreceptor subtype transcriptomes in zebrafish
Notes: Cell type profiling only, no intervention

Title: Identification of fibrotinflammatory subsets in cutaneous GVHD
Notes: Skin tissue, no ocular or light relevance

Title: Mapping the daily rhythmic transcriptome in the diabetic retina
Notes: Circadian rhythm study in diabetic retina, light is environmental variable, no PBM or myopia context

Title: Light modulation rescues RP model
Notes: Red light used as environmental modifier, but core focus is genetic RP model

Title: Classic chick form-deprivation myopia
Notes: Older microarray dataset, but solid biological model

Title: Egr1 knockout developmental myopia
Notes: Developmental/genetic mechanism, not intervention model

Title: Lens-induced myopia time-series RNA-seq
Notes: Excellent design, time-course, multiple tissues

Title: Occlusion myopia induction and recovery RNA-seq
Notes: Clear contrast groups, ideal for DEG and pathway analysis

Title: Retina/RPE/choroid transcriptome in FDM chick
Notes: Good FDM model; pooled samples reduce statistical power

Title: Violet light protection in chick myopia
Notes: Light intervention present, but wavelength is violet not red

Title: LRP2 mutation model of eye enlargement
Notes: Genetic model of high myopia, not intervention-driven

Title: FDM with multiple anti-myopia treatments in chick
Notes: Large sample size, ideal for shared treatment-pathway mining

Title: Control arm of optical defocus project
Notes: Must be paired with treated series to be meaningful

Title: SuperSeries optical defocus gene networks
Notes: Must use subseries only; cannot analyze as standalone dataset

Title: Choroid scRNA-seq in emmetropization
Notes: Unique tissue- and cell-type level insight, high biological value

Title: Mouse FDM retina RNA-seq
Notes: Very small sample size (n=3), useful for validation only

Title: Primate form-deprivation myopia transcriptomics
Notes: Older technology but rare primate model

Title: Chick myopia
Notes: Classic chick form-deprivation myopia retina dataset; older platform but biologically aligned and usable for trend/pathway analysis.

Title: Egr1 knockout retinal transcriptome
Notes: Genetic/developmental effect, not intervention

Title: Muller cell stretch transcriptomics
Notes: Mechanical stress in vitro, indirect relevance

Title: Human fetal vs adult scleral miRNA
Notes: Developmental comparison, not experimental myopia

Title: Mfrp mutant retinal degeneration study
Notes: Retinal degeneration model, indirect myopia link

Title: miRNA retina/sclera in mouse FDM
Notes: miRNA-focused but biologically aligned

Title: ZNF644 retinal development study
Notes: Developmental epigenetics, weak myopia link

Title: Lens-induced chick myopia RNA-seq
Notes: Excellent core dataset

Title: Occlusion myopia induction and recovery RNA-seq
Notes: Core dataset for comparative analysis

Title: miRNA-mRNA networks in mouse FDM
Notes: Strong regulatory analysis, niche focus

Title: Pathway analysis identifies altered mitochondrial metabolism, neurotransmission, structural pathways and complement cascade in retina/RPE/choroid in chick model of form-deprivation myopia
Notes: Chick FDM and recovery retina/RPE/choroid; pooled samples reduce statistical power but still useful for pathway/module trends.

Title: Expression analysis of chicken chorioretinal tissues in control and myopic eyes with or without violet light
Notes: Light intervention present but wavelength is violet (not red/PBM). Useful only if you include wavelength/light-spectrum comparison; otherwise may distract from red-light focus.

Title: Proteolytic processing of LRP2 on RPE cells regulates BMP activity to control eye size and refractive error
Notes: Genetic LRP2 loss-of-function model with eye enlargement/high-myopia phenotype; useful as background mechanism (BMP/LRP2) but not intervention myopia/PBM.

Title: Human fetal RPE eQTL analysis
Notes: Genetics resource, not experimental myopia

Title: Multi-tissue miRNA in mouse lens-induced myopia
Notes: Good tissue coverage, low n

Title: Retinal networks for defocus detection
Notes: Mechanistic focus, not direct myopia model

Title: Gene expression across 4 and 24 hours of growth modulating paradigms in chicks
Notes: Large RNA-seq dataset (54 retina) across FDM, recovery, and multiple anti-myopia treatments (e.g., atropine); excellent for shared pathway/module discovery.

Title: Genome-wide analysis of microRNA-mRNA gene regulatory networks reveals widespread involvement of microRNAs in visually guided eye emmetropization and myopia [miRNA retina]
Notes: Retina miRNA profiling in lens/defocus-induced myopia (mouse); strong regulatory layer but better as a miRNA-focused sub-analysis rather than core PBM narrative.

Title: miRNA networks in mouse sclera (defocus myopia)
Notes: Strong miRNA regulatory data, but niche focus

Title: mRNA retina in defocus-induced myopia
Notes: Direct in vivo retina transcriptomics

Title: mRNA sclera in defocus-induced myopia
Notes: Direct scleral transcriptome, rare and valuable

Title: SuperSeries emmetropization networks
Notes: Must use subseries datasets

Title: Chick defocus-induced myopia (1 day)
Notes: Early-response transcriptomics

Title: Chick defocus-induced myopia (3 days)
Notes: Timepoint-resolved transcriptome

Title: Chick defocus-induced myopia (6 days)
Notes: Well-controlled short-term induction model

Title: Optical defocus control series
Notes: Control only, requires paired dataset

Title: Genome-wide analysis of gene regulatory networks in chickens reveals dynamic temporal changes in retinal signaling cascade underlying compensation to lens-imposed optical defocus [lens induced]
Notes: Chick lens-induced myopia (-10D) retina RNA-seq time course; strong model for defocus-driven myopia transcriptional response.

Title: Genome-wide analysis of gene regulatory networks in chickens reveals dynamic temporal changes in retinal signaling cascade underlying compensation to lens-imposed optical defocus
Notes: SuperSeries; must analyze individual SubSeries (e.g., 1d/3d/6d or control/treatment arms) rather than the SuperSeries as a standalone dataset.

Title: Diurnal retina/choroid expression in chick myopia onset
Notes: Temporal resolution + two tissues

Title: Single Cell Transcriptomics Identifies Distinct Choroid Cell Populations Involved in Visually Guided Eye Growth
Notes: Chick choroid scRNA-seq comparing FDM recovery vs control; high-value for choroid cell-type localization of myopia/emmetropization pathways.

Title: ScRNA-seq analysis of in vivo rat choroid and rat choroid in vitro co-cultured with human pluripotent stem cell (hPSC) derived endothelial cells
Notes: Choroid scRNA-seq but focuses on in vitro co-culture/endothelial interaction; pathological myopia mentioned only as context; weak alignment to myopia intervention.

Title: miR-204 in ARPE-19 cells
Notes: In vitro cell line, limited relevance to in vivo myopia

Title: Diurnal retina/choroid transcriptomics in chick myopia
Notes: Progression vs onset design, mechanistically strong

Title: LRP2 knockdown in iRPE cells
Notes: In vitro knockdown system

Title: Scleral RNA-seq in guinea pig LIM
Notes: Direct scleral remodeling transcriptomics

Title: Mouse FDM retina RNA-seq
Notes: Small n but valid biological model

Title: Scleral RNA-seq in guinea pig FDM + quercetin
Notes: Direct scleral mechanism, limited n

Title: Remarkable composition shift of cone subtypes combined with changes on phototransduction due to cone mosaicism induced by ARR3 variants
Notes: ARR3 variant cone mosaicism scRNA-seq; genetic phototransduction mechanism, not experimental myopia intervention and not PBM.
